name: Blue Rug Juniper
climate: Blue Rug Juniper thrives in temperate climates and can withstand cold winters.
This plant prefers areas with well-defined seasonal changes for optimal growth.
It is adaptable to hot, dry climates and can handle summer heat quite well.
Humidity is not a major concern, making it suitable for various environments.
sunlight: Blue Rug Juniper requires full sunlight for at least 6 to 8 hours each day.
While it tolerates partial shade, growth is optimal with more sunlight exposure.
Full sun conditions support its dense foliage and compact growth habit.
Insufficient sunlight can lead to leggy growth and less vibrant foliage color.
watering: Water young plants regularly to help establish deep, healthy roots.
Once established, Blue Rug Juniper is drought-tolerant and requires minimal watering.
Overwatering can lead to root rot, so ensure soil is dry before watering again.
During dry spells, consider occasional deep watering to maintain plant health.
soil: Prefers well-drained soil; sandy or rocky soils are highly suitable.
Avoid heavy clay soils, as poor drainage can negatively affect the plant.
Soil pH can range from slightly acidic to slightly alkaline for best results.
Regular soil amendment with organic matter can enhance growth and health.
extra_care_tip: Prune Blue Rug Juniper in late winter or early spring to maintain shape and remove dead wood.
